</tr>
</table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:6pt;">&#160;</p>

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The notes to the consolidated financial statements are an integral part of these statements.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">7</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">PERCEPTRON, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</span></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(UNAUDITED)</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000326" name="us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000326_dcnt_188aae6d-1578-4043-8cfa-0070b0f44f20">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">1.<span style="margin-left:36pt;"></span>Accounting Policies</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Perceptron, Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) develops, produces and sells a comprehensive range of automated industrial metrology products and solutions to manufacturers for dimensional gauging, dimensional inspection and 3D scanning.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s products provide solutions for manufacturing process control as well as sensor and software technologies for non-contact measurement, scanning and inspection applications. The Company also offers value added services such as training and customer support. </p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000344" name="prcp:BasisOfAccountingAndConsolidationPolicyPolicyTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Basis of Presentation and Principles of Consolidation</p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The accompanying unaudited Consolidated Financial Statements have been prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of America (&#8220;U.S. GAAP&#8221;) for interim financial information and within the rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#8220;SEC&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Accordingly, they do not include all of the information and notes required by U.S. GAAP for complete financial statements.&#160;&#160;The Consolidated Financial Statements include the accounts of the Company and its wholly-owned subsidiaries.&#160;&#160;All significant intercompany accounts and transactions have been eliminated in consolidation.&#160;&#160;In the Company&#8217;s opinion, these statements include all normal recurring adjustments necessary for a fair presentation of the financial statements for the periods presented.&#160;&#160;The results of operations for any interim period are not necessarily indicative of the results of operations for a full fiscal year.&#160;&#160;The accompanying unaudited Consolidated Financial Statements should be read in conjunction with the audited Consolidated Financial Statements in the Company&#8217;s 2019 Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended June 30, 2019.</p></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000345" name="us-gaap:UseOfEstimates" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Use of Estimates</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Management is required to make certain estimates and assumptions under U.S. GAAP during the preparation of these Consolidated Financial Statements.&#160;&#160;These estimates and assumptions may affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities as well as the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period.&#160;&#160;Actual results could differ from those estimates.<span style="font-style:italic;"> </span></p></ix:nonNumeric>
</ix:nonNumeric><p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">8</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:continuation id="F_000326_dcnt_188aae6d-1578-4043-8cfa-0070b0f44f20" continuedAt="F_000326_dcnt_c4cf38fa-4284-460d-84ab-88e3686b52f6"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000346" name="prcp:RevisionOfPreviouslyIssuedFinancialStatementsPolicyTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000346_dcnt_0854e167-7e8b-46e2-a2e3-92b9dd8877f1">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Revision of Previously Issued Financial Statements</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">During the fourth quarter of fiscal 2019, an error was identified related to the accounting for the Company&#8217;s deferred tax liabilities associated with certain amortizable intangible assets acquired in 2015.&#160;&#160;The error related to not appropriately reducing the associated deferred tax liabilities for the tax effect of amortization on the intangible assets since 2016.&#160;&#160;The error was immaterial to the Company&#8217;s previously issued financial statements, but the cumulative correction would have had a material effect on the 2019 financial statements.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, the results for the three and six months ended December 31, 2018 and three and six months ended December 31, 2017 have been adjusted to incorporate the revised amounts, where applicable.&#160;&#160;See Note 1, of the Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements, &#8220;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies - Revision of Previously Issued Financial Statements&#8221; contained in Item 8 of the Company&#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for further discussion</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000347" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfErrorCorrectionsAndPriorPeriodAdjustmentsTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000347_cnt_1">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:8.42%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">-</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:9.46%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000424" name="us-gaap:WeightedAverageNumberOfDilutedSharesOutstanding" contextRef="C_0000887226_20171001_20171231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">9,597</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

</table></div></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">As a result of the above revision, Total Comprehensive Income was increased from $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000425" name="us-gaap:ComprehensiveIncomeNetOfTax" contextRef="C_0000887226_srtRestatementAxis_srtScenarioPreviouslyReportedMember_20181001_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">1,178</ix:nonFraction> to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000426" name="us-gaap:ComprehensiveIncomeNetOfTax" contextRef="C_0000887226_20181001_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">1,240</ix:nonFraction> for the three months ended December 31, 2018.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The consolidated statements of cash flow are not presented because there is no impact on total cash flows from operating activities, investing activities, and financing activities.&#160;&#160;Certain components of net cash provided by operating activities changed, as caused by the revision, but the net change amounted to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000427" name="prcp:NetChangeInNetCashProvidedByOperatingActivitiesDueToRevision" contextRef="C_0000887226_20181001_20181231" decimals="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">zero</ix:nonFraction> for the three months ended December 31, 2018.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric></ix:continuation><p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">9</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:continuation id="F_000326_dcnt_c4cf38fa-4284-460d-84ab-88e3686b52f6"><ix:continuation id="F_000346_dcnt_0854e167-7e8b-46e2-a2e3-92b9dd8877f1">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">As a result of the above revision, in the consolidated statement of shareholder&#8217;s equity, net income was increased from $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000428" name="us-gaap:NetIncomeLoss" contextRef="C_0000887226_srtRestatementAxis_srtScenarioPreviouslyReportedMember_20181001_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">1,547</ix:nonFraction> to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000429" name="us-gaap:NetIncomeLoss" contextRef="C_0000887226_20181001_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">1,609</ix:nonFraction> for the three months ended December 31, 2018&#59; accumulated other comprehensive loss was decreased from $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000430" name="us-gaap:AccumulatedOtherComprehensiveIncomeLossNetOfTax" contextRef="C_0000887226_srtRestatementAxis_srtScenarioPreviouslyReportedMember_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">2,864</ix:nonFraction> to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000431" name="us-gaap:AccumulatedOtherComprehensiveIncomeLossNetOfTax" contextRef="C_0000887226_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">2,862</ix:nonFraction> at December 31, 2018 and retained earnings was increased from $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000432" name="us-gaap:RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit" contextRef="C_0000887226_srtRestatementAxis_srtScenarioPreviouslyReportedMember_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">3,978</ix:nonFraction> to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000433" name="us-gaap:RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit" contextRef="C_0000887226_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">5,179</ix:nonFraction> at December 31, 2018.</p>

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

</table></div></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">As a result of the above revision, Total Comprehensive Income was increased from $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000498" name="us-gaap:ComprehensiveIncomeNetOfTax" contextRef="C_0000887226_srtRestatementAxis_srtScenarioPreviouslyReportedMember_20180701_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">1,673</ix:nonFraction> to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000499" name="us-gaap:ComprehensiveIncomeNetOfTax" contextRef="C_0000887226_20180701_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">1,797</ix:nonFraction> for the six months ended December 31, 2018.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The consolidated statements of cash flow are not presented because there is no impact on total cash flows from operating activities, investing activities, and financing activities.&#160;&#160;Certain components of net cash provided by operating activities changed, as caused by the revision, but the net change amounted to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000500" name="prcp:NetChangeInNetCashProvidedByOperatingActivitiesDueToRevision" contextRef="C_0000887226_20180701_20181231" decimals="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">zero</ix:nonFraction> for the six months ended December 31, 2018.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">As a result of the above revision, in the consolidated statement of shareholder&#8217;s equity, net income was increased from $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000501" name="us-gaap:NetIncomeLoss" contextRef="C_0000887226_srtRestatementAxis_srtScenarioPreviouslyReportedMember_20180701_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">2,439</ix:nonFraction> to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000502" name="us-gaap:NetIncomeLoss" contextRef="C_0000887226_20180701_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">2,563</ix:nonFraction> for the six months ended December 31, 2018&#59; accumulated other comprehensive loss was decreased from $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000503" name="us-gaap:AccumulatedOtherComprehensiveIncomeLossNetOfTax" contextRef="C_0000887226_srtRestatementAxis_srtScenarioPreviouslyReportedMember_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">2,864</ix:nonFraction> to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000504" name="us-gaap:AccumulatedOtherComprehensiveIncomeLossNetOfTax" contextRef="C_0000887226_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">2,862</ix:nonFraction> at December 31, 2018 and retained earnings was increased from $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000505" name="us-gaap:RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit" contextRef="C_0000887226_srtRestatementAxis_srtScenarioPreviouslyReportedMember_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">3,978</ix:nonFraction> to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000506" name="us-gaap:RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit" contextRef="C_0000887226_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">5,179</ix:nonFraction> at December 31, 2018.</p></ix:continuation></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">10</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000327" name="us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsAndChangesInAccountingPrinciplesTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000327_dcnt_89d794b7-d5f2-4b7e-b3f0-bf84b4e74c7d">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">2.<span style="margin-left:36pt;">New Accounting Pronouncements&#160;&#160;</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Recently Issued Accounting Pronouncements</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In June 2016, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#8220;FASB&#8221;) issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2016-13, <span style="font-style:italic;">Financial Instruments &#8211; Credit Losses (Topic 326)</span> (ASU 2016-13), which requires the measurement of all expected credit losses for financial assets held at the reporting date to be based on historical experience, current conditions as well as reasonable and supportable forecasts.&#160;&#160;In November 2018, the FASB issued ASU 2018-19, <span style="font-style:italic;">Codification Improvements to Topic 326, Financial Instruments &#8211; Credit Losses </span>(ASU 2018-19).&#160;&#160;ASU 2018-19 clarifies that receivables arising from operating leases are not within the scope of ASU 2016-13.&#160;&#160;ASU 2016-13, as amended, is effective for the Company on July 1, 2020, with early adoption permitted.&#160;&#160;The Company does not expect the impact of the adoption of ASU 2016-13 to be material on its consolidated financial statements.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In July 2018, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2018-09 <span style="font-style:italic;">&#8212;</span> <span style="font-style:italic;">Codification Improvements</span> (ASU 2018-09), which clarifies, corrects and makes minor improvements on a wide variety of Topics in the Codification.&#160;&#160;The amendments make the Codification easier to understand and apply by eliminating inconsistencies and providing clarifications.&#160;&#160;The transition and effective dates are based on the facts and circumstances of each amendment, including some amendments that will be effective upon issuance of the update and many of them will be effective for annual periods beginning after December 31, 2018.&#160;&#160;For the amendments that were effective upon issuance of the Update, there was no material impact to the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements or disclosures.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In August 2018, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2018-13 &#8211; <span style="font-style:italic;">Fair Value Measurement (Topic 820): Disclosure Framework &#8211; Changes to the Disclosure Requirement for Fair Value Measurement</span> (ASU 2018-13), which changes the disclosures related to, among other aspects of fair value, unrealized gains and losses, the range and weighted average of significant unobservable inputs used to develop Level 3 fair value measurement and the narrative description of measurement uncertainty.&#160;&#160;ASU 2018-13 is effective for the Company on July 1, 2020 and is not expected to have a significant impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements or disclosures.&#160;&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In August 2018, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2018-15 &#8211; <span style="font-style:italic;">Internal-Use Software (Subtopic 350-40): Customer&#8217;s Accounting for Implementation Costs Incurred in a Cloud Computing Arrangement That is a Service Contract </span>(ASU 2018-15), which aligns the requirements for capitalizing implementation costs incurred in a hosting arrangement that is a service contract with the requirements for capitalizing costs incurred to develop or obtain inter-use software.&#160;&#160;ASU 2018-15 is effective for the Company on July 1, 2020.&#160;&#160;The Company is currently evaluating the impact of this standard on its consolidated financial statements and disclosures. </p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In November 2019, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2019-11&#8212;<span style="font-style:italic;">Codification Improvements to Topic 326, Financial Instruments&#8212;Credit Losses</span> (ASU 2019-11). The amendments in this Update represent changes to clarify, correct errors in, or improve the Codification. The amendments make the Codification easier to understand and easier to apply by eliminating inconsistencies and providing clarifications. The effective dates and transition requirements for ASU 2019-11 are the same as ASU 2016-13. ASU 2019-11 is effective for the Company on July 1, 2020. The Company is currently evaluating the impact of this standard on its consolidated financial statements and disclosures.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In December 2019, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2019-12&#8212;<span style="font-style:italic;">Income Taxes (Topic 740): Simplifying the Accounting for Income Taxes</span> (ASU 2019-12). The amendments in this ASU simplify the accounting for income taxes by removing certain exceptions to the general principles in Topic 740. The amendments also improve consistent application of and simplify GAAP for other areas of Topic 740 by clarifying and amending existing guidance. ASU 2019-12 is effective for the Company on July 1, 2021. The Company is currently evaluating the impact of this standard on its consolidated financial statements and disclosures.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In January 2020, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2020-01&#8212;<span style="font-style:italic;">Investments&#8212;Equity Securities (Topic 321), Investments&#8212;Equity Method and Joint&#160;&#160;Ventures (Topic 323), and Derivatives and Hedging (Topic 815)&#8212;Clarifying the Interactions between Topic 321, Topic 323, and Topic 815 (a consensus of the Emerging Issues Task Force)</span> (ASU 2020-01). The amendments in this ASU clarify certain interactions between the guidance to account for certain equity securities under Topic 321, the guidance to account for investments under the equity method of accounting in Topic 323, and the guidance in Topic 815, which could change how an entity accounts for an equity security under the measurement alternative or a forward contract or purchased option to purchase securities that, upon settlement of the forward contract or exercise of the purchased option, would be accounted for under the equity method of accounting or the fair value option in accordance with Topic 825, Financial Instruments. These amendments improve current GAAP by reducing diversity in practice and increasing comparability of the accounting for these interactions. ASU 2020-01 is effective for the Company on July 1, 2021. The Company is currently evaluating the impact of this standard on its consolidated financial statements and disclosures.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric><p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">11</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:continuation id="F_000327_dcnt_89d794b7-d5f2-4b7e-b3f0-bf84b4e74c7d">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Recently Adopted Accounting Pronouncements</span><span style="font-style:normal;color:#000000;"> </span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In February 2016, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2016-02 <span style="font-style:italic;">Leases </span>(ASU 2016-2), which establishes a right-of-use (&#8220;ROU&#8221;) model that requires a lessee to record a ROU asset and a lease liability on the balance sheet for all leases with terms longer than 12 months.&#160;&#160;The Company adopted this guidance on July 1, 2019, using the modified retrospective approach.&#160;&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The adoption of the standard resulted in the recognition of net operating lease right-of-use assets of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000507" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseRightOfUseAsset" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapAdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaapAccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member_20190701" decimals="-5" scale="6">4.0</ix:nonFraction> million and operating lease liabilities of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000508" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseLiability" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapAdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaapAccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member_20190701" decimals="-5" scale="6">3.9</ix:nonFraction> million on the condensed consolidated balance sheet as of July 1, 2019 primarily related to the Company&#8217;s real estate operating leases.&#160;&#160;The operating lease right-of-use asset includes the impact of deferred rent.&#160;&#160;The Company does not have any finance leases. </p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company elected to apply the package of practical expedients upon transition, which includes no reassessment of whether existing contracts are or contain leases and allowed for the lease classification for existing leases to be retained. The Company did not elect the practical expedient to use hindsight, and accordingly the initial lease term did not differ under the new standard versus prior accounting practice.&#160; After transition, in certain instances, the cost of renewal options will be recognized earlier in the term of the lease than under the previous lease accounting rules.&#160; The Company has selected as its accounting policy to keep leases with a term of twelve months or less off the balance sheet and recognize these lease payments on a straight-line basis over the lease term.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">See Note 10 of the Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements, &#8220;Leases&#8221; contained in this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for further information on the impact of the new standard.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In February 2018, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update 2018-02<span style="font-style:italic;">&#8212;Income Statement&#8212;Reporting Comprehensive Income (Topic 220): Reclassification of Certain Tax Effects from Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income</span> (ASU 2018-02), which<span style="font-style:italic;"> </span>allows for a reclassification from accumulated other comprehensive income to retained earnings for stranded tax effects resulting from the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.&#160;&#160;ASU 2018-02 was adopted on July 1, 2019 and did not have a significant impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements or disclosures.</p></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000328" name="us-gaap:GoodwillDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">3.<span style="margin-left:36pt;">Goodwill</span></p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Goodwill is not subject to amortization and is reviewed at least annually in the fourth quarter of each year using data as of March&#160;31 of that year, or earlier if an event occurs or circumstances change and there is an indicator of impairment.&#160; The impairment test consists of comparing a reporting unit&#8217;s fair value to its carrying value. A reporting unit is defined as an operating segment or one level below an operating segment.&#160;&#160;Goodwill is recorded in the Company&#8217;s CMM reporting unit.&#160;&#160;A significant amount of judgment is involved in determining if an indicator of goodwill impairment has occurred. Such indicators may include, among others: a significant decline in expected future cash flows&#59; a significant adverse change in legal factors or in the business climate&#59; unanticipated competition&#59; and the testing for recoverability of a significant asset group. The Company&#8217;s goodwill impairment analysis also includes a comparison of the aggregate estimated fair value of all reporting units to the total market capitalization. Therefore, the Company&#8217;s stock may trade below its book value and a significant and sustained decline in the Company&#8217;s stock price and market capitalization could result in goodwill impairment charges.</p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The quantitative goodwill impairment test contains estimates regarding future revenue growth and expense levels.&#160;&#160;To the extent that actual results do not meet projected results, it could result in a material impairment to goodwill which could negatively impact the Company&#8217;s results of operations. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In the fourth quarter of fiscal 2019, the Company completed its annual goodwill impairment testing. The impairment test consisted of a quantitative assessment due to a decrease in the Company&#8217;s stock price in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2019 and uncertainty with future revenue growth primarily due to companies postponing decisions about purchasing new capital goods such as CMMs.&#160;&#160;Based on the results of the fiscal 2019 annual impairment test, the fair value of the Company&#8217;s CMM reporting unit was less than its carrying value. As a result, the Company recorded a non-cash goodwill impairment charge of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000509" name="us-gaap:GoodwillImpairmentLoss" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">6.0</ix:nonFraction> million due to the lack of projected growth in the sales of its Off-Line Measurement Solutions.&#160;&#160;This impairment is not deductible for income tax purposes. </p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Goodwill is recorded on the local books of the Company&#8217;s CMM reporting unit. Foreign currency effects will impact the balance of goodwill in future periods. The Company&#8217;s goodwill balance was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000510" name="us-gaap:Goodwill" contextRef="C_0000887226_20191231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1,715,000</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000511" name="us-gaap:Goodwill" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190630" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1,741,000</ix:nonFraction> as of December 31, 2019 and June&#160;30, 2019, respectively, with the decrease due to the differences in foreign currency rates at December 31, 2019 compared to June&#160;30, 2019.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">At December 31, 2019, there are no indications of potential impairment of goodwill.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">12</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000329" name="us-gaap:IntangibleAssetsDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">4.<span style="margin-left:36pt;">Intangible</span> Assets</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company acquired intangible assets consisting of a Trade Name and Customer/Distributor Relationships in addition to goodwill in connection with the acquisitions of Coord3 and NMS in the third quarter of fiscal 2015 which is considered the Company&#8217;s CMM reporting unit.&#160;&#160;Furthermore, the Company continues to develop intangibles, primarily software. These assets are susceptible to shortened estimated useful lives and changes in fair value due to changes in their use, market or economic changes, or other events or circumstances.&#160;&#160;The amortization periods for customer/distributor relationships, trade name and software are&#160;<ix:nonNumeric id="F_000512" name="us-gaap:FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetUsefulLife" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapFiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsByMajorClassAxis_us-gaapCustomerRelationshipsMember_20190701_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">five years</ix:nonNumeric>,&#160;<ix:nonNumeric id="F_000513" name="us-gaap:FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetUsefulLife" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapFiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsByMajorClassAxis_us-gaapTradeNamesMember_20190701_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">ten years</ix:nonNumeric>&#160;and&#160;<ix:nonNumeric id="F_000514" name="us-gaap:FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetUsefulLife" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapFiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsByMajorClassAxis_us-gaapComputerSoftwareIntangibleAssetMember_20190701_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">five years</ix:nonNumeric>, respectively.&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">During the fourth quarter of fiscal 2019, due to the impairment indicators discussed in Note 3, the Company assessed whether the carrying amounts of its long-lived assets in the CMM reporting unit (the asset group) may not be recoverable and therefore may be impaired. To assess the recoverability, the undiscounted cash flows of the asset group were analyzed over a range of potential remaining useful lives with the customer relationships as the primary asset.&#160;&#160;The result was that the asset group carrying value exceeded the sum of the undiscounted cash flows.&#160;&#160;After a fair value analysis, the Company determined that the trade name and customer relationships were impaired. The Company recorded a non-cash impairment loss related to these definite-lived intangible assets of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000515" name="us-gaap:AssetImpairmentCharges" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">1.4</ix:nonFraction> million.&#160;There were no impairment indicators for other long-lived assets subject to amortization.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">At December 31, 2019, there are no indications of potential impairment of these intangible assets.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000348" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfFiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s intangible assets are as follows (in thousands):</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>

<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">June 30,</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%;white-space:nowrap;">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Contract Balances</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Deferred commissions<span style="font-style:normal;"> &#8211; The Company&#8217;s incremental direct costs of obtaining a contract, which consist primarily of sales commissions, are deferred and amortized based on the timing of revenue recognition over the period of contract performance.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2019, capitalized commissions of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000604" name="us-gaap:CapitalizedContractCostGross" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapBalanceSheetLocationAxis_us-gaapOtherCurrentAssetsMember_20191231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">249,000</ix:nonFraction> were included in &#8220;Other current assets&#8221; on the Consolidated Balance Sheet.&#160;&#160;Commission expense recognized during the three and six months ended December 31, 2019 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000605" name="us-gaap:SalesCommissionsAndFees" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapIncomeStatementLocationAxis_us-gaapSellingGeneralAndAdministrativeExpensesMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">227,000</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000606" name="us-gaap:SalesCommissionsAndFees" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapIncomeStatementLocationAxis_us-gaapSellingGeneralAndAdministrativeExpensesMember_20190701_20191231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">417,000</ix:nonFraction>, respectively, is included in &#8220;Selling, general and administrative expense&#8221; in the Consolidated Statement of Operations.&#160;&#160;Commission expense recognized during the three and six months ended December 31, 2018 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000607" name="us-gaap:SalesCommissionsAndFees" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapIncomeStatementLocationAxis_us-gaapSellingGeneralAndAdministrativeExpensesMember_20181001_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">304,000</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000608" name="us-gaap:SalesCommissionsAndFees" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapIncomeStatementLocationAxis_us-gaapSellingGeneralAndAdministrativeExpensesMember_20180701_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">558,000</ix:nonFraction>, respectively, is included in &#8220;Selling, general and administrative expense&#8221; in the Consolidated Statement of Operations.</span></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
</ix:nonNumeric><p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">14</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:continuation id="F_000330_dcnt_1f73c097-bcac-4797-af79-b89c3e6ba20e">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The change in the Company&#8217;s net Unbilled receivables / (Deferred revenue) from July 1, 2019 to December 31, 2019 was primarily due to the amount of revenue recognized as the Company satisfied performance obligations during the six months ended December 31, 2019, partially offset by the amount and timing of invoicing during that same timeframe related to the Company&#8217;s Measurement Solutions and 3D Scanning Solutions.&#160;&#160;During the six months ended December 31, 2019, the Company recognized revenue of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000609" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognized" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">4,371,000</ix:nonFraction> that was included in &#8220;Deferred revenue&#8221; at July 1, 2019. <span style="color:#000000;"> </span>During the six months ended December 31, 2018, the Company recognized revenue of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000610" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognized" contextRef="C_0000887226_20180701_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">4,164,000</ix:nonFraction> that was included in &#8220;Deferred revenue&#8221; at July 1, 2018.</p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000331" name="us-gaap:InvestmentTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">6.<span style="margin-left:36pt;">Short-Term and Long-Term Investments</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">As of December 31, 2019 and June&#160;30, 2019, the Company held restricted cash in short-term bank guarantees.&#160;&#160;The restricted cash provides financial assurance that the Company will fulfill certain customer obligations in China.&#160;&#160;The cash is restricted as to withdrawal or use while the related bank guarantee is outstanding.&#160;&#160;Interest is earned on the restricted cash and recorded as interest income.&#160;&#160;<span style="color:#000000;">As of </span>December 31, 2019 <span style="color:#000000;">and </span>June&#160;30, 2019<span style="color:#000000;">, the Company had short-term bank guarantees of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000611" name="us-gaap:ShortTermInvestments" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapInvestmentTypeAxis_prcpBankGuaranteesMember_20191231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">232,000</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000612" name="us-gaap:ShortTermInvestments" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapInvestmentTypeAxis_prcpBankGuaranteesMember_20190630" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">258,000</ix:nonFraction>, </span>respectively.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">At <span style="color:#000000;">December 31, 2019</span>, the Company held a <span style="color:#000000;">long-term investment in preferred stock that is not registered under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended and may not be offered or sold in the United States absent registration or an applicable exemption from registration requirements. The preferred stock investment is currently recorded at $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000614" name="us-gaap:LongTermInvestments" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapInvestmentTypeAxis_us-gaapPreferredStockMember_20191231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000613" name="us-gaap:EquitySecuritiesFvNi" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapInvestmentTypeAxis_us-gaapPreferredStockMember_20191231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">725,000</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> after consideration of impairment charges recorded in fiscal years 2008 and 2009.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2019 there were no changes to the carrying value of the investment resulting from observable price changes in orderly transactions for an identical or similar investment in the issuer.</span></p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000352" name="us-gaap:InvestmentTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000352_cnt_1">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The following table presents the Company&#8217;s Short-Term and Long-Term Investments by category at December 31, 2019 and June&#160;30, 2019 (in thousands):</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000352_cnt_1">

<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;;font-size:11pt;font-family:Century Schoolbook;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td colspan="6" valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:33.46%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt #000000;">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$</p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:14.4%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000637" name="us-gaap:Investments" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementBasisAxis_us-gaapPortionAtOtherThanFairValueFairValueDisclosureMember_20190630" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">5,131</ix:nonFraction></p></td>

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:14.4%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000638" name="us-gaap:Investments" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementBasisAxis_us-gaapEstimateOfFairValueFairValueDisclosureMember_20190630" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">2,156</ix:nonFraction></p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:continuation></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">15</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000332" name="us-gaap:FairValueDisclosuresTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">7.<span style="margin-left:36pt;">F</span>air Value Measurements</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">ASC 820, &#8220;<span style="font-style:italic;">Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures</span>&#8221; is applicable for all financial assets and liabilities as well as nonfinancial assets and liabilities that are recognized or disclosed at fair value in the financial statements on a recurring basis.&#160;&#160;ASC 820 defines fair value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value and requires specific disclosures about fair value measurements.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s financial instruments include investments classified as available for sale, mutual funds, fixed deposits and certificate of deposits at <span style="color:#000000;">December 31, 2019</span>.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">ASC 820 establishes a hierarchy of valuation techniques based upon whether the inputs to those valuation techniques reflect assumptions other market participants would use based upon market data obtained from independent sources (observable inputs) or reflect the Company&#8217;s assumptions of market participant valuation (unobservable inputs).&#160;&#160;These two types of inputs create the following fair value hierarchy:</p>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;color:#000000;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(1)</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;color:#000000;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;"><span style="color:#000000;">Level 1 &#8211; Quoted prices in active markets that are unadjusted and accessible at the measurement date for identical, unrestricted assets or liabilities.</span></p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;color:#000000;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(2)</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;color:#000000;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;"><span style="color:#000000;">Level 2 &#8211; Quoted prices for identical assets and liabilities in markets that are not active, quoted prices for similar assets and liabilities in active markets or financial instruments for which significant inputs are observable, either directly or indirectly.</span></p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;color:#000000;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(3)</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;color:#000000;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;"><span style="color:#000000;">Level 3 &#8211; Prices or valuations that require inputs that are both significant to the fair value measurement and unobservable and reflect management&#8217;s estimates and assumptions.</span></p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">ASC 820 requires the use of observable market data if such data is available without undue cost and effort.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000353" name="us-gaap:FairValueAssetsMeasuredOnRecurringBasisTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000353_cnt_1">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The following table presents the Company&#8217;s investments at <span style="color:#000000;">December 31, 2019</span> and <span style="color:#000000;">June&#160;30, 2019</span> that are measured and recorded at fair value on a recurring basis consistent with the fair value hierarchy provisions of ASC 820 (in thousands).&#160;&#160;The fair value of the Company&#8217;s short-term investments approximates their cost basis.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000353_cnt_1">
<div>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:auto;border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:37.16%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Description</span></p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1.4%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:13.9%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt #000000;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">December 31, 2019</p></td>

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1.4%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 1</p></td>

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1.4%;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:13.08%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt #000000;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 2</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Fair value estimates are made at a specific point in time based on relevant market information and information about the financial instrument. These estimates are subjective in nature and involve uncertainties and matters of significant judgment and, therefore, cannot be determined with precision. Changes in assumptions could significantly affect these estimates. At <span style="color:#000000;">December 31, 2019</span>, the Company did <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000647" name="us-gaap:ImpairmentOfInvestments" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">no</ix:nonFraction>t record any other-than-temporary impairments on its financial assets required to be measured on a recurring basis.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company also measures certain assets and liabilities at fair value on a nonrecurring basis.&#160;&#160;These assets are tested for impairment when events or circumstances occur which may indicate that the derived fair value is below carrying cost or on an annual basis in accordance with applicable GAAP.&#160;&#160;For these assets, the Company does not periodically adjust carrying value fair value except in the event of an impairment.&#160;&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">There were <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000648" name="us-gaap:AssetsFairValueDisclosure" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsNonrecurringMember_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000649" name="us-gaap:LiabilitiesFairValueDisclosure" contextRef="C_0000887226_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsNonrecurringMember_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">no</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> assets or liabilities measured at fair value on a non-recurring basis at <span style="color:#000000;">December 31, 2019</span>.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">16</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" /><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000333" name="us-gaap:InventoryDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">8.<span style="margin-left:36pt;">Inventory</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Inventory is stated at the lower of cost or net realizable value using the first-in, first-out (&#8220;FIFO&#8221;) method.&#160; The Company provides a reserve for obsolescence to recognize inventory impairment for the effects of engineering change orders, and for age and use of inventory that affect the value of the inventory.&#160; The reserve for obsolescence creates a new cost basis for the impaired inventory. &#160;When inventory that has previously been impaired is sold or disposed of, the related obsolescence reserve is reduced resulting in the reduced cost basis being reflected in cost of goods sold.&#160; A detailed review of the inventory is performed annually with quarterly updates for known changes that have occurred since the annual review.&#160; Inventory, net of reserves of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000650" name="us-gaap:InventoryValuationReserves" contextRef="C_0000887226_20191231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2,048,000</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000651" name="us-gaap:InventoryValuationReserves" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190630" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1,778,000</ix:nonFraction> at December 31, 2019 and June&#160;30, 2019, respectively, is comprised of the following (in thousands):</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000354" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfInventoryCurrentTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000887226_20190701_20191231" escape="true">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
